intro: Scrophularia fluminensis, commonly known as the Brazilian figwort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Scrophularia fluminensis is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
